channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Imposes New Sanctions to Squeeze Russia’s Energy Sector
item.description: The Biden administration is cracking down on the Russian “shadow fleet” and taking steps to curb oil and gas production.

item.title: Elon Musk aims to reignite Tesla’s fading momentum by making Model Y look like the Cybercab
item.description: Much is riding on the refreshed Model Y, slated to launch in March. The six-year-old crossover accounts for two out of every three Teslas sold.

item.title: Meta staffers reportedly furious after Mark Zuckerberg’s hate speech update allows ‘allegations of mental illness’ based on gender or sexual orientation
item.description: Staffers say Meta is in "total chaos" following the changes announced by CEO Mark Zuckerberg.

item.title: Venezuela’s Autocrat Detains U.S. Citizens As He Tightens Grip on Power
item.description: President Nicolás Maduro was sworn in for another six years on Friday, after claiming to win an election in July that many inside and outside Venezuel...

item.title: Can Carlyle catch up? Storied PE firm tries to reclaim its former glory
item.description: Can Carlyle catch up? Storied PE firm tries to reclaim its former glory

item.title: Firefighters Battle Large Blaze at Bronx Apartment Building
item.description: Over 200 firefighters and emergency medical workers responded to the fire early Friday. Seven people have been injured and many residents displaced.

item.title: Friday Briefing: Racing to Control Los Angeles Fires
Ryanair is suing a passenger who was so disruptive on a flight he forced the plane to land over 1,000 miles away from its destination
item.description: Ryanair is seeking damages after it needed to pay for hotel accommodations and other expenses for 160 passengers.

item.title: Rare Winter Storm Sweeps Across the South, Dumping Ice and Snow
item.description: The storm was sweeping across a wide swath of the South on Friday, dumping a mix of wintry precipitation from Oklahoma to Georgia.

item.title: Man arrested for arson by LAPD at site of major Californian fire
item.description: Los Angeles district attorney Nathan Hochman has vowed to come down hard on anyone found guilty of arson.

item.title: U.S. Imposes New Sanctions to Squeeze Russia’s Energy Sector
item.description: The Biden administration is cracking down on the Russian “shadow fleet” and taking steps to curb oil and gas production.

item.title: With Hearings Imminent, Partisan Fight Escalates Over Trump Cabinet
item.description: Democrats are demanding that Republicans slow consideration of picks for the new administration until they can review background checks, as the G.O.P....

item.title: Israel Strikes Ports and a Power Plant in Houthi-Controlled Parts of Yemen
item.description: Israel and its allies have escalated strikes against the Houthis to try to force them to stop firing on Israel and Red Sea shipping lanes, but it was ...

item.title: 2024’s Record-Breaking Heat Brought the World to a Dangerous Threshold. Now What?
item.description: Global temperatures last year crept past a key goal, raising questions about how much nations can stop the planet from heating up further.
